result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A. Froehlich Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Attorney fee deposits in the amount of $450 have been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald A. Froehlich Jr.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:22 p.m. Defendant Ronald A. Froehlich in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Mann - DE waives the preparation of a PSI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Defendant to obtain HSED or GED, Comply with SORP, any other terms or conditions as ordered by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, Court appointed attorney fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. The defendant may petition for early termination if all conditions are met and request is joined by agent.  Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mann states resolution reached & requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:24 PM: Defendant Ronald A. Froehlich in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 09:05 am.

Defendant must comply with all Sex Offender Registration requirements - must abide by all those rules.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:08 PM: Defendant Ronald A. Froehlich in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he was found not eligible for SPD services due to employment/income.   Def requests Court appoint counsel understanding he will be responsible for the fees incurred.  Court willing to appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250  no later than 8/28/2015, with a PP commencing 10/1/2015 of $100 per month - payment to continue on the 1st of every month until further order.  SPD argues for $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Def makes statement as to bond conditions requested.  The Court:  Orders $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
